doc.field: Special Parcels: City of Charlottesville 2007 GIS Datasets (Datastack)

This collection (stacked series) of datasets is provided to the UVA Library's Scholars' Lab by the Information Technology Department of the City of Charlottesville, Virginia, USA, and is provided AS-IS with no guarantees as regards to its accuracy or temporal currency. It pertains primarily to the infrastructure and land use within the City of Charlottesville as well as related natural features. * // * The temporal extent of the datasets in the datastack is generally in the 2002 - 2007 range, but some datasets may include attribute data collected during previous field surveys. * // * Datasets/Layers included in this datastack (with non-exclusive list of included attributes): * City Boundaries * City Neighborhoods * Cultural Points of Interest * Voting Precincts * Elementary School Attendance Zones * Buildings and Structures (footprints only) * Walls and Fences * Parcels (polygon shape) - incl. parcel#, zoning, and historic designation info. * Parcel Points (center points) - incl. property & parcel#, address, zip code, owner, zoning, legal description, acreage. * Developments - incl. development name, construction status, planner, # housing units, and neighborhood. * Parks - incl. park name and type. * Open Spaces - incl. name and acreage. * Elevation Contours - 2 ft. amsl contours, index and interval contours noted or separated. * Street Centerlines - street name, FIPS code, additional geocoding/address matching info. * Street Edges * Guard rails * Parking areas * Driveways * Railroads * Bicycle routes * CTS bus routes * Pedestrian sidewalks and paved trails * Rivanna Trail Foundation (RTF) Trails * City Trails - incl. surface type and existing or proposed status. * Road Stream Crossings - incl. structure and construction type * Stream Utility Crossings - incl. type and stream impact score. * Hydrants - incl. hydrant type, city id#, year installed, size, and condition. * Manholes - incl. manhole type, characteristics and condition, # services, depth, owner, and use status. * Water Lines and Pipes - incl. diameter, install date, construction, owner, use status, and node/junction info. * Water Valves - incl. city id#, street and cross location, and other city specs. * Sanitation Lines and Pipes - construction type, diameter, inspection date, condition, owner, and use status. * Storm Sewer Structures - incl. structure type, depth, size, easements, and condition. * Storm Culverts - incl. culvert type, diameter, easements, and condition. * Storm Pipes - incl. drain type, diameter, easements, and condition * Storm Drainage Basins * Floodplains * Floodways * Streams and Rivers * Stream Characteristics (of selected stream segment/reaches) - incl. watershed, stream name, survey date, stream health characteristics. * Stream Cross-Sections (of selected stream segment/reaches) - incl. watershed, stream name, bankfull height, profile depth, and substrate type. * Stream Erosion (along selected stream segment/reaches) - incl. survey date, and erosion severity. * Stream Buffers (along selected stream segment/reaches) - incl. survey date, bank condition, and need for buffer or restoration. * Stream Head Cut (of selected stream segment/reaches) - incl. head height. * Stream Obstructions (of selected stream segment/reaches) - incl. survey date and obstruction type. * Stream Pipe Ditches (along selected stream segment/reaches) - incl. pipe diameter and type, discharge, and stream impact. * Stream Dump Sites (along selected stream segment/reaches) - incl. dump site id# and material dumped. * Greenway Asphalt Paths: Existing and Proposed * Greenway Combo Bike/Pedestrian Paths: Existing * Greenway Bike Lanes: Proposed * Greenway Class A & B Trails: Existing and Proposed * Greenway Off-River Trail: Proposed * Greenway Sidewalks: Existing and Proposed * Greenway Bridges * Greenway Access Points: public with/without facilities, neighborhood, and from meadowcreek parkway. * Greenway Boat Access Points * // * These data were made available to the University of Virginia for educational and research uses only. Access is restricted to students, faculty and staff of the University of Virginia.
